TEI.2.document_type: Public Notice concerning Land Office money

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to his colonists, March 5, 1825 Concerning Land Office money.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1054-1055

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to his colonists, March 5, 1825 Concerning Land Office money.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*public notice*/p*
*p*Is hereby given that in future the orders drawn on me by the *person_mentioned*Surveyors*/person_mentioned* and accepted commonly called *location_mentioned*Land Office*/location_mentioned* Money will only be received in discharge of debts due by the *person_mentioned*Settlers*/person_mentioned* for the surveying or other expences on their *location_mentioned*Lands */location_mentioned*and that I will not be accountable for the payment of such orders in any other way, all persons who hold any of the above paper are notified to present it without delay.*/p* *p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-05-1825">5th March 1825 */date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin [Rubric]*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
